intro: Oenothera chrysantha, commonly known as the yellow evening primrose, is a herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are tubular with five petals, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Oenothera chrysantha is also known for its ability to attract nocturnal pollinators such as moths.
